text: Accompanied by zany CARTOON MUSIC, the TITLE CARD reads:

Below are two cameos of the cartoon's stars.  One picture of a cherubic baby in a bonnet innocently posed with his thumb in his mouth.  The other is of a paunchy rabbit wit gap between his front teeth.  He has a loveable, if sligh shell-shocked look.  The cartoon begins...
are in a playpen when TWO FEMALE LEGS in high heels walk FRAME.  The VOICE belonging to the legs talks down to Bab Herman in a maternal coo.
Mommy's going to the beauty parlor, darling.  But I'm leaving you with your favorite friend, Roger.  He's going to take very, very good care of you... (voice turns ominous)

... cause if he doesn't, he's going back to the science lab! Roger gulps as he watches the legs disappear.  We HEAR FOOTSTEPS recede and a DOOR SLAM.  Roger turns confidentl back to his charge.  But the little tyke is already squee through the playpen bars.
Baby bye-bye... Roger makes a dive for him, misses, and gets his head stu between the bars.  He pleads with the Baby in a voice tha resonates of Huntz Hall in "The Bowery Boys".
Hey, come back!  You heard what your mother said!
ignores Roger.  We FOLLOW HIM as he crawls into the kitch He stops to regard something that has caught his attentio a cookie jar.  It's sitting on top of the refrigerator.
Coo-kie.

wearing the playpen like a pillory, comes running toward kitchen.  But the playpen is too wide to clear the door. impact SHATTERING the playpen and sends Roger sprawling across the kitchen floor.  When he looks up...
is swinging precariously on the door of the freeer.

Hang on, Baby.  I'll save you! Roger makes a desperate leap across the kitchen for the k But Baby Herman swings the door to the freezer open and R disappears inside.  Baby Herman grabs a cookie and swings back, shutting the door.  He climbs down and crawls out o the kitchen.  After a beat, the freezer door opens.
now shaped like a block of ice, falls out and hits the fl The block SHATTERS into ice cubes.  Roger looks around, dazed.
has taken this opportunity to crawl out the window.  Roge races to the window.  His eyes pop out of his head at wha sees.

Baby Herman is crawling along the sidewalk under the shad of a safe being hoisted into a second floor window by the Acme Safe Moving Company.  The rope holding the safe is fraying down to a slender thread.

gasps and rockets out the window toward Baby Herman.  The rope snaps.  The safe falls.  Roger arrives just in time pluck the Baby out of harm's way.  But not in time to sav himself.  The safe CRUNCHES down on his head, burying Rog into the sidewalk.  After a beat, Roger's hand appears an spins the tumbler.  The safe door opens.  Inside, we see dazed rabbit with little TWEETING BIRDS circling his head

Cut, cut, cut! The cartoon action stops abruptly, but the goofy CARTOON MUSIC PLAYS ON.  We begin a slow PULL BACK TO REVEAL that this cartoon is being filmed LIVE ON A SOUND STAGE.  The title card sits on an easle.  The female legs are paper mache' props manipulated by two HUMAN CREW MEMBERS.  Wear they lean the legs up against the stage wall.  A human DIRECTOR, wearing a tweed jacket and baggy pleated pants, steps onto the set.  From the equipment and the dress of crew, we can tell it's the 1940's.  Baby Herman throws hi cookie down in disgust.  He talks in a gravelly voice an octave lower than Wallace Beery's.
What the hell was wrong with that take??
Nothin' with you, Baby Herman.  It's on Roger... again! (over shoulder)

Hey!  Could we lose the playback? The MUSIC suddenly STOPS as, off to the side, the SOUNDMA lifts the needle off a phonograph record.  The Director l over Roger and angrily plucks one of the birds circling h head.
(continuing)
What's this, Roger?
(sheepish)
A tweeting bird?
That's right, a tweeting bird.  But what does the script say?  'Rabbit gets conked.  Rabbit sees stars!'  Not birds, stars!

Aw, for cryin' out loud, Roger!  I'll be in my trailer... takin' a nap! Baby Herman pulls himself up to his full height of two fe and walks off the set.  He chooses a route that takes him under the dress of the SCRIPT GIRL.  She jumps as if goos Now two CREW MEMBERS lift the safe off Roger.
Please, Raoul.  I can give you stars, I know I can.  Just drop the safe on my head one more time.
I've already dropped it on you twenty-three times.
Don't worry about me.  I can take it.

I'm not worried about you.  I'm worried about the safe. CONTINUED PULLBACK. What we've been seeing has been from the POV of a MAN in shiny brown suit standing unobtrusively at the back of th sound stage.  Under a beat-up fedora is a craggy face tha seen a lot in its life... but apparently didn't think muc it was funny.  EDDIE VALIANT takes a jolt from a pint of whiskey, evidently in reaction to what he's seen.  He ope his coat and returns the pint bottle to a shoulder holste which had formerly held a .38.  Nerves steadied, he walks the stage door.

Valiant emerges from the stage onto a bustling Hollywood studio lot where CARTOON CHARACTERS (TOONS) and humans ar comingling as if it were the most natural thing in the wo Valiant stops by an Acme Novelty truck which is unloading Toon props.  There are bombs, rockets, flattened pocket watches, anvils, giant slingshots, etcetera.  The license plate is California 1946.  He fishes out a pack of Chesterfields and taps out a half a butt that had been stubbed out.  As he lights it, Valiant regards a chubby, balding man wearing a three-piece suit and a worried expression coming towards him.  He is R.K. MAROON, studio boss.  Maroon is leading an entourage of ASSISTANTS tryin keep up.

Starting tomorrow there'll be no more roast beef lunches.  What happened to cheese sandwiches?  I was raised on cheese sandwiches. As the Assistants dutifully record his thoughts, Maroon s a GUY taking a nap in the shade of a palm tree.
(continuing)
And tell that guy sleepin' over there he's fired!
It's your wife's brother, R.K.
(reconsiders)
Oh... tell him he's promoted.  But get him out of my sight. As the Assistants disperse, Maroon approaches Valiant.
Valiant, did you see the rabbit?
He was blowin' his lines, all right. So what?
So what?  He's already put me three weeks behind on the shooting schedule! Now an EDITH HEAD-TYPE hustles up to show Maroon several costume designs.
Your reaction, R.K.? Maroon quickly checks out the drawing.
No!  That's not funny.
She flips another drawing.
(continuing)
That's funny.  Put a homburg on him it'll even be funnier.  Huh, Valiant? He grabs the pad and shows Valiant.  The rendering is of hippo in a pink polka-dot tu-tu.
(deadpan)
Yeah, that'd be a riot. Maroon responds to Valiant's sarcasm with raised eyebrows
Boy, I hope what you have ain't contagious or I'll be out of business. He hands the pad back to the designer, who departs.
(continuing)
How much do you know about show business, Valiant?
Only there's no business like it, no business I know. Valiant watches an ALLIGATOR in a rebel uniform dragging brace of cannons and several TOADSTOOLS parade by.
Yeah, and there's no business as expensive.  I'm twenty-five grand over budget on the latest Bunnysitter cartoon and it's all because that rabbit can't keep his mind on his work. And you know why?
One too many safes dropped on his head?
Nah, that goes with the territory. He's a stunt bunny. Maroon takes a copy of the "Hollywood Tattler" out of his pocket.
(continuing)
Here's the problem... (reads)
"Seen cooing over calamari with notsonew Sugar Daddy was Jessica Rabbit... wife of Maroon star, Roger". (looks up)
His wife's a tramp, but he thinks she's Betty Crocker.  The doubt's eatin' him up.
So what do you want me to do?
Get me a couple juicy pictures. Somethin' I can wise the rabbit up with.
I don't work in Toontown.
You don't have to.  The rabbit's wife sings at an underground Toon revue joint called The Ink & Paint Club.  You can catch her in action there.
The job's gonna cost you a hundred bucks.
A hundred bucks?  That's ridiculous.
So's the job. Valiant starts to walk away.

All right, all right... You got your hundred bucks. Maroon turns, snaps his fingers.  His Assistant appears o of nowhere with Maroon's checkbook and a pen.  The Assist turns and stoops so that Maroon can write the check on hi back.
(continuing)
Fifty now, fifty when you deliver the pictures. Maroon tears the check off and hands it to Valiant.  Sudd Valiant ducks in reflex to a large shadow that passes overhead.
(continuing; chuckles)
Kinda jumpy aren't you, Valiant?  It's just Dumbo.
swoops back and forth, then hovers, ears flapping like a hummingbird.
I got him on loan from Disney.
Aren't you the lucky one... Valiant grabs the check from Maroon and starts for the ga
When will I hear from you?

As soon as is humanly possible. We FOLLOW Valiant out the gate under a wrought iron sign reads "Maroon Cartoon Studios".  As he starts across the he's almost run over by a Toon roadster that ROARS out of gates.  When it BLASTS ITS HORN, it's the FIRST FIVE NOTE from the WOODY WOODPECKER SONG:  "HA-HA-HA-HA-HA".  Valia jumps back as the roadster passes.  WOODY THE WOODPECKER' behind the wheel with a self-important smile on his face. Valiant angrily waves the cloud of Toon dust away.
(coughs)
Damn Toons.

is slowing to a stop in front of the studio.  It's a Paci and Electric "Red Car", part of a vast system of electric trollies that once criss-crossed the L.A. Basin.  Valiant steps onto the "Red Car".  He reaches into his pocket to the CONDUCTOR his nickel fare.  But he comes up with a handful of lint.  He holds out the check.

What do I look like, a bank? The Conductor jerks his thumb toward the door.  Valiant suffers the public humiliation,of having to step down pas the rest of the boarding passengers.  He walks around to back of the Red Car where a gang of TEN-YEAR-OLDS are loitering.  When the BELL SOUNDS and the Red Car starts t pull away, the Kids make a dash for a place on the cow catcher.  Valiant joins them.  We HOLD as the Red Car mov away and the street urchins regard their older partner in crime with curiosity.

It reads:  "L.A.'s Pacific and Electric Red Car -- Americ Finest Public Transportation System".  PAN DOWN to see th the sign is on the roof of the trolley terminal.  Red Car are going in and out of the shed.  MOVE IN on one car approaching the terminal from down the street.  As it pas by...
hops off his freeloader's seat on the back,
So long, mister. Valiant waves laconically.
Thanks for the cigarettes. We FOLLOW Valiant as he crosses the street to a seedy bungalow.  A note is push-pinned to the door.
It says:  "Tomorrow's Friday... Well?  Dolores".

takes the note and walks back across the street toward th terminal.  He climbs up a flight of stairs, heading for a on the mezzanine.  The bar sports a red neon sign that us to blink, "The Terminal Station Bar".  But now it just sa "Terminal".

The place must have been pretty swanky at the turn of the century when it was built in the first burst of enthusias over the new public transportation system.  It's in the m of a trolley car.  There's a large map on the wail above bar showing all the different lines.  Behind the bar is DOLORES.  If you scraped off all the makeup, you'd find a attractive woman in her late thirties.  She ministers to rag-tag assortment of Hollywood low-lifes -- who are trul the end of the line.

enters this den, lets his eyes adjust for a moment, then bellies up to the bar.  He finds a spot between a ONE-ARM BLACK SOLDIER and a MIDGET stretched out on the bar passe out.  Now a TROLLEY RUMBLES underneath them.  The bar sta to shake like an earthquake, the lights flicker.  All the drinkers, observing a time honored ritual, lift their gla simultaneously to avoid spilling any drops.  Even the Mid lifts his head until the trolley has passed.  Valiant rea over the bar and blind-grabs a bottle of rye he obviously knows is there.  He pours himself a shot.
Hey, fellas, what's the good word?
Lost my job. An ARTHRITIC COWBOY pipes up.
Mule died. A DEAF-MUTE scribbles a note on a pad hanging around his neck.  He hands the note to Valiant.  It says "My girl du me".  Valiant pats him on the back, consoling.

Well, you know what they say about dames, Augie... Then Valiant mouths the rest of it for Augie's benefit on Augie reads his lips, then starts to roar silently, slapp his thigh.  Now Dolores makes her way down the bar.  She grabs the Midget by the suspenders and slides him out of way.

So, makin' dame jokes, huh, Eddie? Well, lemme remind ya pal, it was a dame who took a hundred bucks out of the till so your landlord would't throw you out of your dump.  And it was a dame who trusted you for the money when no one else in town would.  And it's a dame who's tired of waitin' for you to straighten yourself out and get a job!
Would this be the same dame who's going to feel awfully foolish when she finds out I've got her money. Valiant slides the check across the bar.  Dolores studies She calms down a little.
This is fifty bucks.  I need seventy-five before they check the books tomorrow.
You'll have it in the morning.  Now be a sport and lemme have twenty bucks to put in my pocket.
Is this paper even good?
Check the scrawl.
(reads)
R.K. Maroon. Now ANGELO, a Neanderthal sitting a few stools down, is tapping the shell of a hardboiled egg.

Maroon?  Valiant, don't tell me you're workin' for a Toon?  Who's your client? Chilly Willy or Screwy Squirrel? Angelo chuckles at his own joke and goes to eat his egg. Suddenly Valiant darkens.  He grabs Angelo by the shirt a pulls him up to his face.

Get this straight, greaseball.  I'm not workin' for a Toon!  I'd never work for a Toon!  Got that? Valiant jams the whole egg into Angelo's mouth, turns and storms out the door.  Angelo sputters and spits out the e
What's his problem?
Toon killed his brother.
Valiant knocks on the door of, a non-descript building in run-down factory area.  A speakeasy style peephole slides open REVEALING the face of a TOON GORILLA.  Valiant offer the password.
Walt sent me. The peephole slides closed and after a beat the door swin open.
The Gorilla, dressed in a tux, gives Valiant the once ove Valiant resents the assessment.
Like your monkey suit.
Wise ass... We FOLLOW Valiant down the hall toward the main room.  We HEAR LAUGHTER and ZANY MUSIC from within.

When Valiant steps through the doorway, we see the place no dive.  It's a white tablecloth nightclub on a par with El Morroco or the Garden of Allah.  Behind the bar A CATERPILLAR BARTENDER is using his many arms to shake and pour several drinks at once.  Meanwhile a dozen PENGUIN WAITERS are gliding back and forth along the tables servi drinks to the well-heeled crowd.

DONALD DUCK and DAFFY DUCK are seated opposite each other matching grand pianos.  What begins as a decorous Duck du on a Tchaikovsky piece (complete with knuckle-cracking, seat-spinning preparations) quickly accelerates to a loon game of one-upsmanship between these two irascible Ducks. There is keyboard stomping, lid-banging, piano wire pluck zaniness.
is HOWLING.  People are wiping the tears from their eyes they're laughing so hard.  All except...

He lights a cigarette impassively, not humored by the Too hijinx.  He spots an empty table off to the side and make his way towards it.  A SILLY GEEZER in a loud suit is at next table.  The Geezer nods to him soberly as Valiant pu Out the chair and sits down.  A LOUD FLATULENCE SOUND eru from under Valiant.  The Geezer slaps his thigh with the hilarity of it all.
Will you listen to that?  It's a pip! I'm thinking of callin' it a Whoopee Cushion. Valiant reaches under himself and comes up holding a defl rubber bladder.  The Geezer retrieves it from him.
(continuing)

No hard feelings, I hope.  Put 'er there... The Geezer grabs Valiant's hand before he can say no.  We HEAR A BUZZ.  Valiant retracts his hand as if shocked.  T Geezer howls with laughter and turns his palm to Eddie.
(continuing)
Hand buzzer... real gasser. Valiant rolls his eyes and grabs a Penguin as it glides b
Scotch.
There's a two drink minimum.
Just as long as there's no maximum.

Waiter, I'll sign my check now. The Penguin puts a bill down on the Geezer's table and zi off.  The Geezer takes a fountain pen out of his jacket a writes on the bill.  But there doesn't seem to be any ink coming out.  He shakes and shakes the pen to get it flowi It flows all right.  Ink splatters all over Valiant's shi and pants.  Valiant looks down at the stain, doing a slow burn.  The Geezer starts laughing.  Valiant jumps up and grabs him by the lapels.
That's it for you, pops!
(freaked)
Calm down, son.  Look, the ink is gone. Valiant looks down at his shirt.  The stain is gone.
(continuing)
See?  It disappears.
Well, why don't you make like the ink? Valiant drops him into his chair and returns to his seat. The Penguin glides up with his drinks.  Valiant swallows first one with one quick jerk of the head.

Donald and Daffy's PIANO COMPETITION has reached a CRESCE of mayhem.  They've got the axes out, and in time with th MUSIC they reduce their pianos to matchsticks.  At the completion of the piece, they step to the front of the st and with great decorum, arms around each other, they take their bows.  The curtain comes down to GREAT APPLAUSE.  W HEAR SFX of CRASHING AND BASHING backstage.  Now from beh Valiant, we HEAR a familiar high-pitched VOICE.
Cigars... cigarettes... Eddie? Valiant turns to see BETTY BOOP standing with a box of tobacco wares strapped around her neck.  In contrast to a the other Toons, Betty's in black and white.
(continuing)
Gee, it's swell to see you, Eddie.  We miss you in Toontown.
Wish I could say the same.  What're you doin' here, Betty?
Work's been slow for me since the cartoons went to color.  But I still got it, Eddie... (sings)
'Boop boop be-doop'.
Yeah, you still got it, Betty. (indicates Geezer)
Who's Mr. Jocularity?
(leans in)
That's Marvin Acme, the gag king.
Shoulda guessed.
He comes here every night to see Jessica Rabbit.
Big on the musical comedy, huh?
Sounds like you ve never seen her, Eddie. Now the lights dim and Betty moves on.
the dour DROOPY walks out with the spotlight following hi He's the evening's emcee.
(deadpan)

Hello, everybody.  I hope you're all having as much fun as I am.  I have a small announcement to make.  Jessica Rabbit will not be able to sing tonight. There's a ROAR OF DISAPPROVAL from the men in the crowd. They shower him with debris.
(continuing; deadpan)

I was merely jesting.  Without further ado... here's woman times two, Toontown's own chanteuse par excellance... Jessica Rabbit! There is excited APPLAUSE as the lights dim. A TOON COMBO made up of CROWS in shades STRIKES UP the intro to the sm song, "Why Don't You Do Right".  A spotlight hits the curtain. Now a curvaceous leg pokes out, teasingly.  The crowd goes wild as the rest of the body belonging to the emerges.  JESSICA RABBIT is a generously endowed red-head bombshell.  She's a humanoid Toon... in her case, more beautiful than human.  Her figure is testimony to what a can do with a pencil and a fertile imagination,
This is not quite the bunny he expected Roger to be marri to.  His jaw drops.  And his reaction is mirrored all aro the room.  The men are panting so hard you couldn't keep match lit.
as she steps to the mike.
(sings)
'You had plenty of money back in '22
You let other woman make a fool of you

Why don't you do right. Like some other men do... Get out of here and Get me the money too...' Jessica takes the mike and comes off the stage.  Slinkily she wanders among the tables, teasing the men as she goes Now there's a HOWL from behind Valiant.  A Tex Avery type TOON WOLF, who came masquerading as a human, couldn't hel but show his true colors at the sight of Jessica.  He HOW as if it were a full moon.  His tongue rolls out of his h and piles up on the floor like so much clothesline.  His eyeballs telescope out of his head.  And finally, the Wol levitates and snaps rigid like an open jacknife.  As the makes a rush for the stage, the Gorilla Bouncer grabs him the suspenders.  The Wolf, legs spinning madly, practical knocks Valiant's table over as he grabs at Jessica.  But Wolf has come to the end of his suspenders.  He snaps bac toward the Gorilla who is holding an anvil in front of th suspenders.  CLANG!  The Wolf hits the anvil and slides t the floor.  The Gorilla calmly whisks him into a dustpan carries him out.
like all good saloon singers, has continued her act undaunted.
(singing)

'Why don't you do right. Like some other men do...' She sashays over to the Geezer's table.  Teasingly, she swirls the whisps of white hair onto his head into a Dair Queen.  He giggles gleefully and makes a grab at Jessica. But she slips out of his grasp like mercury.
(continuing)

'You ain't got no money Ain't got no use for you...' Now Jessica works her way over to Eddie.  She stops at hi table and sings tauntingly.  Then with a flourish, she th herself in his lap, and belts out the finale.
(continuing)
'So get out of here... And get me the money toooo!' There is RAUCOUS APPLAUSE when she finishes.  Jessica loo deep into Eddie's eyes.
(continuing)

Thanks for your lap. Before Eddie can reply, she jumps off, and slinks offstag leaving Eddie a pile of human wreckage.  Valiant slugs th rest of his drink down to put out the fire in his libido. When the lights come up, Valiant looks over to where Acme slicking down his eyebrows and patting his hair down.  He stands, picks up a bouquet of roses from the chair beside him, and as he passes Valiant's table, gives him a big wi Valiant watches Acme disappear backstage.  He stands, dro a couple bucks on the table, and follows after him.

Valiant steps past the curtain, keeping a discreet distan He follows Marvin Acme down a corridor and around the cor Acme stops and knocks on a dressing room door.  After a moment, it opens and Acme goes inside.  Valiant checks ov his shoulder, but the backstage area is empty.  He eases to the door and puts his eye to the keyhole.

Jessica is seated at her dressing table.  Acme is on his knees next to her, kissing his way up her gloved hand, ey closed in ecstasy.  Jessica takes her hand out of the glo and starts combing her hair, leaving Marvin kissing a suspended Toon glove.
while he continues his peeping.  The Gorilla bouncer snea up behind him.
Hey, whaddaya think you're doin', chump?
Who're you callin' chump, chimp? The Gorilla smiles sadistically when he recognizes Valian
Oh, it's da comedian... The Gorilla grabs Valiant by the belt and lifts him off t ground.  He opens the fire door and heaves Valiant out.
Valiant comes flying out the door and CRASHES into a bunc garbage cans in the alley.  The Gorilla stands in the doo regarding the dazed Valiant.
And don't lemme catch your peepin' face around here again.  Got it?

Ooga-booga. The Gorilla slams the door.  Valiant picks himself up out the garbage.  He brushes himself off, then starts down th alley toward the rear of the building.  We FOLLOW him aro the corner where he stops under Jessica's dressing room window.  He drags over a milk crate to stand on, takes a small camera out of his pocket and opens the bellows.  He stands on the crate and aims the camera through the corne the window, as we HEAR the MUFFLED CONVERSATION from with
Are we going to play pattycake tonight?
Marvin, I have a headache...
(hurt)
But you promised...
Oh, all right.  But this time take that hand buzzer off... Valiant's eyes widen in disgust.
Jesus Christ... As he starts CLICKING pictures...
There's one light on in the Administration building.

It's a large art deco office with walls covered with phot of Maroon and various celebrities, human and Toon.  R.K. Maroon is seated behind his desk.  Standing nearby is Valiant.  They are both regarding a hysterical Roger Rabb who's holding a set of 8 x lO glossies.  He's WAILING and CRYING, Toon tears flooding off him in a torrent.
Pattycake!  Pattycake!
Baker's man... but no use ruinin' a good pair of shoes over it.
Roger's tears have formed a puddle around the desk.  Vali lifts a well-worn oxford and shakes the water off it.
hands Roger his handkerchief.  Roger AAH-OO-GA'S his nose
Take comfort, son, you're not the first man whose wife played pattycake on him.
I don't believe it.  I won't believe it.
The pictures don't lie.  Mr. Valiant here took them himself. Roger takes another look at the pictures.
They're shots of Jessica Rabbit and Marvin Acme seated kn to knee, caught in the act of slapping palms... really playing pattycake.
Maroon gets up and crosses to a bar table set up by the window.  He pours a drink from a crystal decanter as Roge starts sobbing again.
But Jessy... she's the light of my life, the apple of my eye, the cream in my coffee... Valiant eyes the booze longingly as he mutters to himself
Well, you better start thinkin' about drinkin' it black.

Frankly, I'm shocked.  Marvin Acme's been my friend and neighbor for thirty years. Maroon gestures out the window.  We see a blinking neon s on the roof of the building across the street -- "Acme - It's Acme - It's A Gasser!"
(continuing)
Who would have thought he was the Sugar Daddy? Maroon turns and carries the drink to Roger.  Meanwhile, Valiant sidles over to the bar to help himself.
(continuing)
Well, the important thing now Roger, is to put all this behind you. (hands him drink)
Drink this, son, you'll feel better. Roger takes the glass and shoots it down in one gulp.
(continuing)
I know this all seems painful now, but you'll find someone new.  Won't he, Mr, Valiant? Eddie has just picked up the decanter to pour one for himself.
(over shoulder)
Oh, yeah.  Good lookin' guy like him. Dames'll be breakin' his door down.

The booze is taking its effect.  There's a RUMBLE like a volcano about to erupt.  Suddenly Roger's head turns into Toon steam whistle SHRIEKING.  The HIGH PITCH causes glas objects in the room to SHATTER... including the crystal decanter that Valiant's holding in his hand.  It EXPLODES soaking his suit with booze.  Valiant looks down at the damage, completely exasperated.
Son-of-a-bitch... (turns)
Mr. Maroon, I think I'll be goin' now, so about the rest of my fee...
Sure, Valiant, sure... Maroon sits at the desk and writes a check.
Being experienced in these matrimonial matters, you have any advice for our friend here? Valiant crosses to the desk and takes the check.
My advice?  Hop on over to Reno, get yourself a quickie divorce.
Divorce?  Never! Suddenly Roger jumps onto Maroon's desk and grabs Valiant the lapels.

Marriage is a two-way street and we're just experiencing a detour!  Jessica and I are going to get back together. We're going to be happy!   H-A-P-P-I! Roger zips off the desk and CRASHES out the window, leavi rabbit outline in the glass... backlit by the blinking Ac sign.  Maroon and Valiant walk to the window and look out rabbit-shaped hole in the window.
At least he took it well.

PULL BACK TO REVEAL the bottle's on the floor next to the couch Valiant's passed out on.  He's still dressed in his clothes.  PAN the small studio apartment.  In the kitchen/alcove, Valiant has created a makeshift darkroom. see a curtain on a clothesline.  Various trays, and some pictures clipped up on clothespins.  The pictures depict Jessica Rabbit and Marvin Acme in various states of pattycake.  Now there is LOUD POUNDING on the door.  But doesn't break through VaLiant's subconscious for several seconds.  Finally, he rouses, gets up and walks a crooked line to the door.  Valiant opens it and squints into the excruciating sunlight.  When his eyes focus, REVEAL a hang-dog POLICE DETECTIVE holding Eddie's morning paper.
Lieutenant Santino... how ya doin'? Santino ignores the question and regards Valiant with a mixture of disgust and pity.
Tell me you didn't do a snoop job for a Toon named Roger the Rabbit.

That's what you woke me up for? Santino flops open the morning paper.  Valiant's eyes nar as he reads it.  The headline screams:  "TOON KILLS MAN!" underneath:  "Marvin Acme Murdered at the Hands of Jealou Rabbit".  Santino throws the paper on the sofa.
You got trouble, Eddie.

An L.A. police car turns into the yard of the Acme factor and pulls up in front of the old factory building.  There all kinds of official activity in the yard... cop cars, a Coroner's truck, etcetera. Valiant and Santino get out of the police car.  Santino starts into the factory.  But he realizes Valiant's not following him.  He turns to see Valiant looking over the behind the factory, transfixed.
Now what?
Just haven't been this close to Toontown for awhile.
The sky above the wall is a different color, a little bit more vibrant, a "Toon Blue", you might call it.
walks back and takes Valiant's arm.

Love that Red Car. As Valiant starts to walk up the hill...

A hearse, and a line of black limos are parked in the lan Nearby, Marvin Acme's funeral is in progress.  Clustered around a gravesite are the mourners... TOONS of every str There's MICKEY MOUSE comforting MINNIE.  TOM AND JERRY. HECKLE AND JECKLE.  CHIP 'N DALE.  Everyone from the famo to the not so famous is in attendance.  The eulogy is bei delivered in a familiar blustery Southern VOICE.  It's FOGHORN LEGHORN.

Today we commit the body of brother Acme to the cold, I say cold, cold ground.  We shed no tears for we know that Marvin is going to a better place. That high, high, I say that high-larious place up in the sky. Foghorn Leghorn dramatically points skyward.
(in unison)
A-men!

is leaning up against a palm tree on the hill.  We have b watching the proceedings from his POV.  Now he sees Maroo car pull up.  He moves around to the other side of the tr as Maroon passes and starts wending his way through the crowd.
Foghorn Leghorn nods to the funeral DIRECTOR, a pasty-fac human in a black mourning coat.  The Director starts to t the crank lowering the coffin into the grave.

Give us a sign, brother Herman, that you've arrived... Much to the funeral Director's amazement, the crank start PLINKING Out the tune to "POP GOES THE WEASLE".  Now the mourners pick up on it and join in.
(singing)
Round and round the mullberry bush, The monkey chased the weasle... The crank and SONG start going FASTER AND FASTER.
(continuing; singing)

The monkey raid it all was in fun.  POP! Goes the weasle. Suddenly half of the lid to Acme's coffin flies open and harlequin CLOWN BOI-YOI-YOINGS out.  The funeral Director faints dead away as the Toon SOBS turn to LAUGHTER.  The Toons turn and head away from the grave comforted by a funeral befitting a gag king.  They climb into their cars SCREECH off like the start of the Indy 500.  One mourner left at the gravesite.  Sitting in a chair dabbing at her eyes with a handkerchief is Jessica Rabbit.  Maroon walks behind her.
So... trying to pull a fast one on me, huh? Jessica turns, startled.  She stands and faces Maroon.

smiles and leans in.  This is the moment he's been waitin for.  Now just as the conversation begins, it is drowned by the NOISE from a LAWN MOWER.  Valiant turns to see a GARDENER riding around on a small tractor cutting the gra Valiant tries to flag him down as he watches Maroon and Jessica having an arguement.  There's accusatory finger pointing.  In pantomime, Maroon gestures into his pocket if describing the position of Acme's will. Jessica tries to leave.  He grabs her arm.  They're screa at each other but we don't hear a word.  Valiant waves frantically for the Gardener to cut the machine.  But the Gardener misconstrues it as a friendly greeting and waves back.  Valiant turns in time to see Jessica kick Maroon i the groin and stomp off to a red Auburn Speedster.  She j in and speeds away as Maroon staggers back to his car.  T Gardener stops the tractor next to Valiant.  He SHUTS OFF ENGINE.  The cemetery is completely still again.
Somethin' you want, mister?
Not anymore...

A Steinway piano truck is parked next to the stage door. husky PIANO MOVERS are rolling a baby grand up the ramp t the stage door.  They knock on the door.  The Gorilla ope it and they muscle the piano inside.  After a moment, the reemerge.  We FOLLOW them back to the truck where a secon baby grand stands ready to be moved.

I don't know about you, but it makes me sick to think of these beautiful pianos gettin' chopped into match sticks every night by those screwy ducks. Struggling, they push this second piano into the club.
They roll the piano over to the wall and park it next to first.
(shakes head)
And they call it entertainment. As they go out the stage door, MOVE IN on the baby grand.

is lying prone -- using the Steinway as his own Trojan Ho He lifts the piano lid to climb out, but then HEARS FOOTS approaching.  He lowers the lid again.  Now someone start testing the keys.  We see the hammers strike the strings, RUNNING UP THE SCALES until they reach the one under Valiant's nose.  The hammer whacks Valiant's nose on the backswing and strikes the string making a terrible SOUR N
(exasperated QUACK)
Phooey!  Out of tune again!
Not to worry, Donald.  We can fix that with my sledgehammer.
Never mind, Daffy.  I've got an axe in my dressing room. Valiant's eyes widen.

as the VOICES of Daffy and Donald recede, Valiant raises lid and quickly climbs out.  He eases over to Jessica's dressing room.  As he starts to open the door, he HEARS SCUFFLING from inside.  Valiant puts his ear to the door. More SCUFFLING.  Valiant straightens, then suddenly whips door open and flicks on the light.

Nobody's there.  Perplexed, Valiant closes the door behin him and checks behind the dressing screen.  In the closet No one.  He shrugs and starts to search the room.  He goe Jessica's dressing table and rifles the drawers.  In her purse he discovers a Toon revolver.  He examines it.

Girl's gotta protect herself. Valiant puts the gun back in the purse and closes the dra As he stands, he pauses to consider a Hurrel-like black-and-white photo of Roger Rabbit in a silver deco fr He's dramatically posed with a cigarette like he was Tyro Power. Valiant shakes his head and turns from the table.  Someth catches his eye.
Behind the dressing table, the corner of a piece of blue paper peeks out.  Valiant stoops down and fishes it out. It's a cover for a legal document -- "Last Will and Testa -- Marvin Acme".
stands, pleased.  He opens the blue folder.  But it's emp Valiant puts it in his inside pocket and turns to go when suddenly an unseen hand flicks the lights off.

Son of a bitch... We can't see anything in the darkness.  But we hear the S of A FISTFIGHT.  There's the CRASHING of lamps and furnit breaking.  Now the door opens for a second as the assaila escapes.  Light floods in the room, illuminating Valiant the floor with a curtain wrapped around his head.  As he struggles free the door closes.  The room is dark again. Valiant scrambles to the door.  When he whips it open, RE the Gorilla framed in the doorway.  Valiant is frozen.  T Gorilla flicks on the light.  He smiles wickedly.
And here I tought we had mice. Valiant tries to make a break for it.  WHAM!  The Gorilla lays him out cold with a right cross.
As his vision comes INTO FOCUS, Valiant sees the Gorilla, Jessica Rabbit, the Weasles and Judge Doom are standing o him.
... I caught him rummagin' around in here.  Then I called you, Judge, on a counta you be da one we pay juice to.
(clears throat)
You did the right thing, Bongo.
pull a groggy Valiant upright and plop him in a chair in front of Doom.
Being caught breaking and entering is not very good advertising for a detective.  What were you looking for, Mr. Valiant?
Ask her... Valiant nods toward Jessica, who stands coolly smoking a cigarette.
Last week some heavy breather wanted one of my nylons as a souvenir.  Maybe that's what he was after?
Look, doll, if I wanted underwear, I woulda broken into Frederick's of Hollywood.  I was lookin' for Marvin Acme's will.
Marvin Acme had no will.  I should know, the probate is in my court.
He had a will, all right.  She took it off Acme the night she and R.K. Maroon knocked him off.  Then she set up her loving husband to take the fall.
You, Mr. Valiant, are either drunk or punch drunk.  Probably both.
These are bold accusations, Mr. Valiant.  I hope you have some proof?
I found the cover the will came in behind the dressing table. Valiant reaches into his pocket.  But the blue envelope i gone.
(continuing)
They must've taken it off me.
They?
The other people who were in here lookin' for the will.  I woulda caught 'em if Cheetah here hadn't interrupted me. The Gorilla makes a move for Valiant.  Doom stops him.
Take it easy, Bongo.  We'll handle Mr. Valiant our own way... downtown.
Downtown?  Fine.  Get a hold of Santino, I'd be more than glad to talk to him.
Oh, not that downtown.  Toontown. The mention of Toontown has a visible impact on Valiant.
(nervous)
You're not takin' me to downtown Toontown?
Indeed we are.  We'll continue the interrogation there.
(very agitated)
I ain't tellin' you nothin'!  Get me Santino.
You're a very stubborn man, Mr. Valiant.  Very pig-headed.  Boys, show Mr. Valiant how we handle pig-headed men at the Toontown station... As the Weasles drag Valiant out of the room...
(screaming)
No... you bastards!  Leggo of me!
The Toon Control Wagon streaks along with the cat SIREN WAILING.  It flashes by then slams on the brakes at the entrance to an eerie tunnel.  A sign next to the tunnel s "Toontown".
The Weasles look over at the bound and gagged Valiant.  O of them turns Valiant's head to look at the Toontown sign
What're you shakin' for?  Didn't you have a good time last time you were here? With a wicked WHEEZE, the driver floors it.
The wagon disappears into the murky darkness.  PAN UP to night sky.

PAN DOWN to the tunnel.  We can't see into the darkness b we HEAR HOOTING and HOLLERING from within.  GUNS going of FIRECRACKERS EXPLODING, WHIPS CRACKING, all accompanied b the WHEEZING LAUGHTER of the Weasles.
Soo-eey!  Soo-eey!

Let him go, boys.  I think he's got the message. After a beat, Valiant comes staggering out of the tunnel. He's got a burlap sack over his head tied around his wais Behind him, the Weasles emerge holding paint cans and brushes.  They watch as he trips and falls by the side of road.  The Weasles GIGGLE victoriously and head back insi Valiant lies there for a moment, catching his breath.  Th he struggles to free his hands.  Finally he rips the sack his head and sits up.

We see he's got a huge Toon pig with a goofy grin painted over his head.  Valiant pulls and tugs on it, but this is costume that won't come off.  Valiant curses, gets to his feet and stumbles down the road.
Valiant gets in the back of the line of PASSENGERS boardi the Red Car.
steps aboard.  The Trolleyman, who we recognize as Earl f the Terminal bar, does a double-take when he sees the ridiculously silly looking man/Toon.
Here's one for the books... a Toon wearin' human clothes.
Earl... it's me, Valiant.
Eddie?  Jesus, what happened?
Toon cops worked me over.
Boy, I'll say.  They gave you a real Toon-a-Roo.
(apprehensively)
What am I, Earl? Earl breaks the news to Valiant soberly.
You're a pig... a happy-go-lucky pig.
No...
Does it hurt?
Not much.  It's hard to talk.

Uh, Eddie, do me a favor.  Could you sit in the back so you won't cause as much of a commotion. Valiant tries to pull the brim of his hat down.  But it's comically small on the huge head.  He makes his way down aisle past a veritable gauntlet of RAZZING, poking, tripp PASSENGERS.  Finally he finds an empty seat in the back a the Red Car starts up.
wearing a baseball cap is sitting a few seats away with h MOTHER.  The Kid looks back at Eddie and laughs.  He lean over and whispers something to his Mom.
Can I, Mom?
Go ahead, darling.  Take your bat. The Kid takes his baseball bat and approaches Valiant innocently.
Hi, Mr. Pig.  If I hit you on the head, will you make me a cuckoo bird? The Kid starts to take a swing with the bat.
Kid, if you hit me on the head, I'm gonna throw you out this window. The Kid's eyes widen in terror.  This is not a typical To response.
(crying)
Mommy!
We hear the SOUND of the SHOWER.  Valiant's hand reaches past the shower curtain and grabs for a bottle.  But it's shampoo.  It's turpentine.
Dammit!
The water swirling down the drain is tinged with paint of different colors.

He scrubs manically until the last of the pig head is gon He rinses off and he feels around his face.  The absence the Toon mask seems to bring him some relief.  He shuts o the shower and slides the shower curtain back.
is leaning up against the doorjamb, dressed as usual, in black cocktail dress with elbow length gloves and pearls.
Hello, Mr. Valiant.  I rang the doorbell, but I guess you couldn't hear it.
That's because I don't have a doorbell. Jessica, caught in her lie, flutters her eyelids nervousl
Oh... well, I... I just had to see you.
Okay, you've seen me.  Now give me a towel. As she hands him a towel, she stares down at his anatomy.
What's that thing? Valiant looks down at what she's referring to.
Come on, lady, haven't you ever seen a mole before?
Toons aren't given imperfections.
No?  I guess we're not counting lying, stealing and murder.
You've got the wrong idea about me. I'a a pawn in this just like poor Roger.  Can you help me find him?  I'll pay you anything.
Yeah, I'll bet you would.  You gotta have the rabbit to make the scam work.
No, no, no... I love my husband.
Oh, sure.  I can just feature you standin' outside your little hutch, holdin' a carrot cake waitin' for hubby to come home.
Oh, please don't make fun of me, Mr, Valiant.  You don't know how hard it is being a woman looking the way I do.
Yeah, well, you don't know how hard it is bein' a man looking at a woman looking the way you do.
I'm not bad, I'm just drawn that way.

I'm not complainin'.  But give me credit.  I'm the guy who took the pictures of you and Acme playin' pattycake, remember? Jessica takes a cigarette out of her purse.  She lights i and blows a cloud of Toon smoke.  It forms a recreation o what she describes.
Maroon came to me.  He told me he'd fire Roger if I didn't do it.  I went along with him for Roger's sake.  It was only pattycake, after all. Valiant waves at the smoke scene, dispelling it.
So altruistic.
It's the truth.  Why won't you believe it?
Cause I don't take Acme Dumb Pills.  I don't know what you're up to, lady, but I'm gonna nail you for the Acme murder.
If I'm as bad as you think, what's stopping me from just killing you right now? Valiant reaches behind him and picks up a small cup on th sink.
This cup of turpentine right here.  Go for that gun in your purse and I'm gonna let you have it. Jessica breaks down and starts sobbing.
Oh, Mr, Valiant, please... you're my only hope. She comes to Eddie and hugs him, burying her head in his shoulder.

I'm weak... you're strong.  Can't you find a place somewhere in your heart to help me? Valiant looks down at the luscious creature in his arms, considering the request.  The moment is interrupted by th CLEARING of a VOICE.
Dabblin' in watercolors, Eddie? Valiant, still in just a towel, sheepishly turns to face Dolores, who's standing in the doorway.
Dolores... Dolores regards Jessica with undisguised contempt.
Lemme guess... your cousin from Des Moines? Jessica straightens her dress.
Perhaps I should go.
Must you?

Goodbye, Eddie... don't hate me. Jessica blows Eddie a TOON KISS which flies across the ro landing on Eddie's cheek.  She saunters past the smolderi Dolores and out the door.  Dolores walks to Eddie and pee the kiss off his cheek.  She crumples it up and throws it down in the wastebasket.
What was that?
That was the rabbit's wife.
The rabbit's wife?  Wanna tell me what she was doin' with her arms around you?
Probably lookin' for a good place to stick a knife.
I just stopped by to tell you that I checked out the Acme probate.
Maroon, right?
Nope.  It's that Cloverleaf outfit again.
(startled)
What the hell would they want with a gag factory?
Got me.  But unless the will shows up by Friday midnight, it's theirs. As Valiant considers this new development, he cocks an ea In the distance, we HEAR FAINT SINGING.
What's that comin' from the bar?
(listens)
Sounds like singin'.
Oh, no... As Valiant grabs his pants...

Roger's out all right.  In fact, he's using the bar as a stage for a song and dance number.  The tune is extremely familiar.  In fact, it's the one that opens every Warner Brothers cartoon...  The Looney Tune Anthem.  But we've n heard words to go with it.
'The merry-go-round broke down But you don't see me frown...' Roger grabs Augie's pad and pencil, scribbles some drawin lightning fast.
(continuing)

'Things turned out fine And now she's mine...' Roger flips through the pad which in crude animation, sho the story of Roger and Jessica getting back together, culminating in them kissing in a heart.  Augie's delighte
(continuing)
'... Cause the merry-go-round Went round... Hoo-hoo, Hoo-hoo...' Roger does backflips and acts like an escapee from the ac ward.
Eddie and Dolores enter.  Valiant stops in his tracks at sight of Roger's performance... and the smiles on the fac of the sourpusses.
doesn't see Eddie.  He moves into the next verse.  He twi around on the post.
'My name is Roger Rabbit I've got a crazy habit I like to sing and dance and yuk...' Roger goes to Angelo, lifts off his cap, and whacks his toupee, making it spin like a top.
(continuing)

'... So brighten up and smile You schmuck'. All the regulars in the bar have a good laugh at that one Now as Roger twirls around on the post, he smashes into a tray held by Eddie.  Valiant carries him toward the back room, but the irrepressable entertainer gets on his knees Jolson style and blows kisses to his audience.  The regul are HOWLING as Roger is carried out.
Valiant flings Roger into the room and slams the door beh him.
Hey, don't I get an encore?
Why, you crazy Toon... I've been out there riskin' my neck for you.   I come back here and you're singin' and dancin'.
But that's my calling, my purpose, my raison d'etre.  Toons are supposed to make people laugh... and believe me, those people needed a laugh.
And when they're done laughin' , they're gonna call the cops.  That guy Angelo would rat on you for a nickel!
Angelo?  He's a pal, a chum...
An arsonist and a kidnapper.  He just got outta prison.
Well... I still don't think he'd turn me in.
Just because you got 'em to laugh?
A laugh can be a powerful thing, Eddie. Sometimes it's the only weapon we have in life.
I think I prefer the Smith and Wesson variety.
I've met some cynical and miserable humans in my time.  But you, Edward Valiant, are positively funereal!
Well, right now it's gonna be your funereal. Valiant takes his fist back to belt Roger.  Roger stands stoicly, jaw thrust forward, eyes closed.
Go ahead and throw that punch. (opens one eye)
But you'd be more successful with a punch line. Valiant drops his fist and rubs his temples with frustrat
You're driving me crazy, you know that? Let's go... you ruined this as a hiding place. Valiant grabs Roger by the scruff of the neck and opens t door.  But he ducks back in quickly.

has entered the bar.  He stands FRAMED in the doorway, Voltaire perched on his shoulder.  The red light of the n sign flashes on his glasses making him look like he's got burning coals for eyes.  With the Weasles at the door bac him up, the satanic Doom walks to the bar, his FOOTSTEPS CREAKING along the wooden floor.  He surveys the scene, l over the bar for a glass.  Doom holds the glass up to the light and looks at it disgustedly.  He picks up a bottle scotch and carries it down to where the one-armed Soldier sitting.  Doom stares at him, then pulls the empty sleeve of the amputee's pocket.  He uses it to wipe the inside o the glass.

I'm looking for a rabbit.  He was last seen in this neighborhood. The barflies avoid Doom's stare and shoot covered glances one another.  But nobody says a word.  Doom pours a drink into his newly cleaned glass... then gently pours it down Voltaire's gullet.
(continuing)
You couldn't miss him.  Buck teeth. Orange pants.  About yea big. Doom squashes the Midget's head down to approximate the s
There's no rabbit here, so don't harass my customers. Doom turns to Dolores.

I didn't come here to harass.  I came here to reward. Doom walks around Dolores toward the back.  But Doom stop next to the blackboard.  On it is written:  "Today's Spec - French Dip - $ .50".  Doom erases the "French" and the decimal point in front of the "50".  Then he picks up the chalk and starts to write.  The CHALK SQUEAKS excruciatin on the blackboard.  Everyone winces but watches anyway, a Doom writes "Rabbit" where the "French" was, and adds the zeroes to the "50".  It now reads:  "Rabbit Dip - $5000".
are fixed on the figure on the blackboard.  Angelo licks lips.
Hey, I seen a rabbit... Angelo looks defensively at all his cronies and back to D
(continuing)
He's right here in the bar. But instead of pointing to the back of the bar, he talks the empty barstool beside him.
(continuing)
Say 'ello, Harvey. The tension is broken.  Everybody at the bar starts HOWLI
Roger turns to Eddie victoriously.
My pal.

Doom stares down the regulars until the laughter stops. Meanwhile, a Weasle has started sniffing around the bar w Roger was dancing.  As Doom turns to leave, the Weasle whispers in his ear as he points to the back.  Doom smile and pats the Weasle on the head.  He turns to Angelo and others.
Now we'll see who laughs best... The Weasle bloodhounds through the bar with Doom striding after him.  We FOLLOW them to the door to the back room. Doom rips the door open.
It's dark.  Doom flicks on the light.  REVEAL Valiant on cot, his pint bottle cradled in his arm.  He blinks as if awakened from a drunken slumber.
Valiant?  Why is it that whenever my men smell a rabbit, you're there? Valiant plumps the pillow behind his head.
Must be my cologne... Eau Dc Carrot.
(sniffs)
He's in here all right, boss. Suddenly the Weasle grabs the pillow from under Valiant's head and carves it to shreds with a switchblade.  Feather fly.  But no rabbit fur.
Youse want we should take the place apart? The rest of the Weasles are arrayed behind Doom with Toon crowbars, picks, and a jackhammer.
No, Sergeant.  That won't be necessary. Doom walks over to the locker.
(continuing)

I know a trick that no Toon can resist. Doom raps on the locker with his knuckles.  Da-da-da-da-d It's a familiar pattern that demands a Da-da response.  D moves to the desk and tries it again.  Da-da-da-da-da...

head_text.subj: INSIDE A MAXWELL HOUSE COFFEE CAN

text: Roger is hiding while sweating out the urge to finish the familiar coda.  We HEAR the RAPPING again, closer. Da-da-da-da-da...  Roger's biting his nails.
moves to the milk crate the coffee can is on.  Valiant ge up off the cot.
You know, Doom, I don't know who's Toonier, you or the rabbit. Doom just smiles and knocks the pattern out on the crate.
Shave... and... a haircut... Roger bursts out of the can with the lid on his head.  He responds con brio.
Two... bits! (looks around)
Uh... oh... PSSSHEW!  Roger flies out the door.

He streaks across the bar and out the front door.   After beat, two Weasles step into the bar holding the butterfly they had stretched across the door.  They WHEEZE with gle the struggling Roger trapped inside.  A third Weasle carr the Judge's briefcase. Doom strides confidently into the bar.

Oyez... oyez... oyez... court is now in session. Valiant and Dolores are led out by a couple Weasles holdi guns on them.  As Doom snaps the briefcase open on the ba the twelve Kangaroos pop up in their jury box.  Doom raps the bar with his gavel-headed cane.  The regulars watch t bizarre scene in stunned silence.

Roger Rabbit is charged with the cold blooded murder of a human... Marvin Acme.  The jury will direct their attention to exhibits A, B, and C. The Weasles display photographs of Jessica and Acme playi pattycake, a blow-up of his fingerprints spelling RogerRabbitRogerRabbit in the whorls on the photographs, a picture of Acme lying under the safe.
(continuing)

Motive, evidence, modus operandi.  How do you find the defendant? Once again the Kangaroo court wastes no time delivering t verdict.  The Baby Kangaroos pop up with their Y-O-U A-R- G-U-I-L-T-Y signs.
(continuing)
Guilty as charged.  Case closed! Doom slams the briefcase shut.  Now two Weasles wheel the stainless steel tub filled with dip into the bar.  Anothe hands Doom his black rubber gloves.
(continuing)
For this heinous crime, I sentence you to the dip!
No, no. not the dip!  Eddie, tell him I didn't do it!
I don't think it's gonna matter. Sorry, pal, I tried.
Yes, and for that you're charged with aiding and abetting.  But we'll let Santino handle that. Doom pulls on the rubber gloves.
Hey, doesn't the rabbit even get a last request?
A blindfold, cigarette, noseplugs? Just kidding.
I think you want a drink. (to Doom)
How about it, Judge?
Well, why not?  I'm feeling magnanimous tonight.  The successful conclusion of this case draws the curtain on my career as a jurist. I'm retiring to take a new role in the private sector.
Yeah?  Well, don't expect the Toons to give you a gold watch. Valiant pours a glass of whiskey filling it all the way t the rim.  He holds it out to Roger.
(continuing)
Here you go, kid... say hi to Casper for me.
But, Eddie, you know what happens when...

Drink it, jerk.  All of it. He grabs Roger's hand and forces the drink into it.  Roge shrugs his shoulders and shoots the drink down.  We've se the reaction before.  Suddenly Roger's head turns into a STEAM WHISTLE emitting such a PIERCING BLAST that is send everyone into ear-grabbing agony.  Glasses, bottles, mirr even Doom's glasses SHATTER.  Valiant uses the distractio punch the Weasles holding Roger.  He grabs the rabbit by scruff of the neck. He gets as assist from Augie, who couldn't hear the noise.  Unfazed, Augie whacks a Weasle the head with a barstool.  The Midget crawls behind Doom, who's been momentarily blinded.  The one-armed Soldier pu him over.  Angelo is turning one Weasle's head around and around like a cruller.  Finally, Doom gets to his feet.
After them you fools... As the Weasles regroup, Valiant tips the stainless steel over sending the dip spilling toward them.  The Weasles recoil from the liquid.  Even Doom takes a step backward.
Eddie and Roger race down the stairs and toward the Toon Control Wagon which is parked in front of Doom's Lincoln,
Oh, Eddie, that was quick thinkin'. Nothin' like usin' the old noggin, the noodle, the grey matter...
If I'm so smart, how come I'm runnin' from the law with a Toon? Valiant opens the door of the Toon Control wagon, and fli Roger inside roughly.
Eddie goes to start the vehicle but the key is gone.   No from behind them comes a DEEP RUMBLING VOICE somewhere between Lord Buckley and Barry White.
Excuse me, gentlemen... Eddie and Roger turn.  A snazzy TOON ROADSTER whose grill functions as it's mouth is talking from behind the liquid bars.
If you effect my extrication, I could offer you some carburetion.
Valiant sighs with resignation and slides out of the cab, Roger in tow.

Eddie and Roger come racing around the side of the wagon. Valiant searches the back of the truck for the on/off swi He finds it and turns off the flow of acetone.  The Roads zips out of the truck and lands on the pavement, already flexing and limbering.   Behind him, a comical number of TOON DETAINEES hop out like midgets out of a Volkswagon. They all head for the hills.
Well... what're we waitin' for, the William Tell Overture?
come piling out.  They stack up like an Indian totem pole searching every direction.  One of them spots Eddie and Roger.  The Weasles stumble all over themselves in a mad scramble down the stairs.
hop into the sleek two-seater.   Valiant looks at the myr of goofy cartoon gauges and switches on the Roadster's dashboard.
What do I do?

You don't have to do nothin'... With a ferocious RUBBER BURNING SQUEAL, the Roadster ROAR off in "no frames".  The exit is so fast that Eddie and R are left behind, hanging mid-air.  But before they hit th ground, the Roadster zips back INTO FRAME.  Eddie and Rog fall back into their seats.  The Roadster bends around so grill is facing them.
(continuing)
Uh... except hang onto your hat. The Roadster ROARS off again in a cloud of Toon dust.
coming the other way.  It's followed by another squad car both with SIRENS BLARING.  When the red blur streaks by, Santino turns to his PARTNER.
What the hell was that?
Speeding rabbit, Lieutenant.
That's what I was afraid of.
Santino's car does a 180 degree spin, and goes after the Roadster.  The second squad car follows.  The Weasles pil into the Toon Control wagon and join the chase.

rockets down the street, then takes a turn so wide that i drives up the front of the corner building, then back dow the sidewalk, just avoiding a newsstand.  The squad car following is not so dexterous.   It CRASHES into the stan sending newspapers flying.
looks back over it's shoulder, admiring his handiwork.
